intro: Mentzelia lagarosa, commonly known as desert blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky slopes, where it has adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mentzelia lagarosa is a member of the Campanulaceae family and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
